justification: The text notes that "A traditional discrete choice task used to study time preferences is the intertemporal choice task," indicating this task is the standard instrument for measuring the construct of time preferences.

In the discussion of Figure 2 the authors describe the "patch-leaving task" and explain that it captures when an animal decides to leave a food patch, contrasting it with the intertemporal choice task and emphasizing its use for assessing foraging-related decision making and patience.
